translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Kuṭaja Flowers
“When a god falls from the god-realm,
at the end of his life,

analyzed: itas bho sugatim gaccha  manussānam sahabyata
translated: ‘Go from here, sir, to a good destination,🔽to companionship with human beings.
As a human being, in the true Teaching,
That faith of yours will be firmly established,
as long as you live, without deception,
establish other people too in the true Teaching,
When the gods know that the god🔽has been approved with this compassion,
saying, ‘Come back, god, again and again.’
I was then moved to tears,
when the assembly of gods had gathered.
will I go to when I fall from here?’
After instructing me in the meaning of the Dhamma,
I purified my mind towards the Buddha.
urged on by the root of merit.
I did not go to a bad destination.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ekacintiko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmai ekacintikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus has it been told by the Elder Ekacintika.
